Typealiases.html#/s:6Jaeger0A5Agenta.name: JaegerAgent
Typealiases.html#/s:6Jaeger0A5Agenta.abstract: An agent using a Core Data Stack to save a binary representation of a JaegerSpan.

Typealiases.html#/s:6Jaeger16CompletionS.name: CompletionStatus
Typealiases.html#/s:6Jaeger16CompletionS.abstract: A function used to acknowledge the end of a task with an optional error message in case of failure.

Typealiases.html#/s:6Jaeger6Binarya.name: Binary
Typealiases.html#/s:6Jaeger6Binarya.abstract: An array of bytes represented by a list of UInt8 (8 bits).

Structs/Tag.html#/s:6Jaeger3TagV3Keya.name: Key
Structs/Tag.html#/s:6Jaeger3TagV3Keya.abstract: The allowed key type for a tag.

Structs/Tag/TagType.html.name: TagType
Structs/Tag/TagType.html.abstract: A list of all acceptable Swift fundamental types to represent the value of a tag.

Structs/Tag.html#/s:6Jaeger3TagV3key7tag.name: init(key:tagType:)
Structs/Tag.html#/s:6Jaeger3TagV3key7tag.abstract: Creates a new tag from a key:value pair.

Structs/Span/Flag.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4.name: sampled
Structs/Span/Flag.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4.abstract: A real span created by a tracer for none debug purpose.

Structs/Span/Reference/ReferenceType.htm.name: childOf
Structs/Span/Reference/ReferenceType.htm.abstract: A span that depends on a child Span in some capacity.

Structs/Span/Reference/ReferenceType.htm.name: followsFrom
Structs/Span/Reference/ReferenceType.htm.abstract: A span that does not depend in any way on the result of a child.

Structs/Span/Reference.html#/s:6Jaeger4S.name: child(of:)
Structs/Span/Reference.html#/s:6Jaeger4S.abstract: Creates a new Reference from a parent span.

Structs/Span/Reference.html#/s:6Jaeger4S.name: follows(from:)
Structs/Span/Reference.html#/s:6Jaeger4S.abstract: Creates a new Reference from a parent span with no dependency to its child span.

Structs/Span/Reference/ReferenceType.htm.name: ReferenceType
Structs/Span/Reference/ReferenceType.htm.abstract: A list of possible relationship between spans.

Structs/Span/Context.html#/s:6Jaeger4Spa.name: init(traceId:spanId:)
Structs/Span/Context.html#/s:6Jaeger4Spa.abstract: Creates a new Context from the trace and span ids.

Structs/Span/Context.html#/s:6Jaeger4Spa.name: traceId
Structs/Span/Context.html#/s:6Jaeger4Spa.abstract: The unique number that identifies the (unique) trace in which the node (span) is part of.

Structs/Span/Context.html#/s:6Jaeger4Spa.name: spanId
Structs/Span/Context.html#/s:6Jaeger4Spa.abstract: A unique number to identify a span.

Structs/Span/Context.html.name: Context
Structs/Span/Context.html.abstract: The minimal information needed to reference a span in a trace.

Structs/Span/Reference.html.name: Reference
Structs/Span/Reference.html.abstract: A reference to a span in a Trace with a relationship context called a ReferenceType.

Structs/Span/Flag.html.name: Flag
Structs/Span/Flag.html.abstract: A flag to identify whether a flag is in a debug state.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV7spanR.name: spanRef
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV7spanR.abstract: The unique identification of the span and its trace.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV06pare.name: parentSpanId
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV06pare.abstract: The parent span id. Nil for a root node.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV13oper.name: operationName
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV13oper.abstract: A human-readable string which concisely represents the work done by the span.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV10refe.name: references
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV10refe.abstract: The list of references to other nodes.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4flagA.name: flag
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4flagA.abstract: This flag specifies if the span is a debug span.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV9start.name: startTime
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV9start.abstract: The time at which the task started.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV7endTi.name: endTime
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV7endTi.abstract: The time at which the task ended.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4tagsS.name: tags
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4tagsS.abstract: The tags set before the completion the span.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4logsS.name: logs
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4logsS.abstract: The logged events that occurrence before the completion the span.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV11isCo.name: isCompleted
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV11isCo.abstract: A boolean indicating if the task is completed.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV6finis.name: finish(at:)
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV6finis.abstract: An action to indicate that the task was completed.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV2eeoiy.abstract: Only the span context is used to verify equality.

Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4hash4.name: hash(into:)
Structs/Span.html#/s:6Jaeger4SpanV4hash4.abstract: Only the span context is combined into the hasher.

Structs/Log.html#/s:6Jaeger3LogV9timesta.name: init(timestamp:fields:)
Structs/Log.html#/s:6Jaeger3LogV9timesta.abstract: Creates a new tag from a log event.

Structs/Log.html#/s:6Jaeger3LogV9timesta.name: timestamp
Structs/Log.html#/s:6Jaeger3LogV9timesta.abstract: The time at which the event occurred.

Structs/JaegerSpan.html#/s:6Jaeger0A4Spa.name: convert(span:)
Structs/JaegerSpan.html#/s:6Jaeger0A4Spa.abstract: Creates a Jaeger Span from an OpenTracing Span.

Structs/JaegerSpan.html#/s:6Jaeger0A4Spa.name: init(span:)
Structs/JaegerSpan.html#/s:6Jaeger0A4Spa.abstract: Creates a Jaeger Span from an OpenTracing Span.

Structs/JaegerBatchProcess.html#/s:6Jaeg.name: serviceName
Structs/JaegerBatchProcess.html#/s:6Jaeg.abstract: The name of the service that emits spans.

Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.name: errorDelegate
Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.abstract: The error delegate. Any core data error or network error will be forwarded to the delegate.

Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.name: maximumSpansPerSecond
Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.abstract: The maximum number of spans per seconds to be saved in memory before the next saving operation on disk.

Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.name: savingInterval
Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.abstract: The time between each saving operation on disk.

Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.name: sendingInterval
Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.abstract: The time between each sending tasks to the collector.

Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.name: maximumSpansPerSavingInterval
Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.abstract: The maximum number of spans to be saved in memory before the next saving operation on disk.

Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.name: maximumSpansPerSendingInterval
Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.abstract: The maximum number of spans fetched from the disk before sending to the collector.

Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.name: coreDataFolderURL
Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html#.abstract: An optional URL to a folder where the core data files will be saved. When not specified the NSPersistentContainer.defaultDirectoryURL() will be used.

Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html.name: CoreDataAgentConfiguration
Structs/CoreDataAgentConfiguration.html.abstract: The configuration used by the CoreDataAgent agent to set up the core data stack and saving behavior.

Structs/JaegerBatchProcess.html.name: JaegerBatchProcess
Structs/JaegerBatchProcess.html.abstract: Description of the service that emits spans.

Structs/JaegerSpan.html.name: JaegerSpan
Structs/JaegerSpan.html.abstract: The Jaeger version of an OpenTracing Span.

Structs/Log.html.name: Log
Structs/Log.html.abstract: An event that occurred at a specific point in time with the information stored as key:value pairs.

Structs/Span.html.name: Span
Structs/Span.html.abstract: A span represents a task that is being accomplished or was accomplished in a distributed system.

Structs/Tag.html.name: Tag
Structs/Tag.html.abstract: An abstract representation of a key:value pair where the key is restricted to

Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.name: startSpan(operationName:referencing:startTime:tags:)
Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.abstract: A point of entry to start a new span wrapped in an OTSpan.

Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.name: startSpan(operationName:childOf:startTime:tags:)
Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.abstract: A point of entry to start a new span wrapped in an OTSpan.

Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.name: startSpan(operationName:followsFrom:startTime:tags:)
Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.abstract: A point of entry to start a new span wrapped in an OTSpan.

Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.name: startRootSpan(operationName:startTime:tags:)
Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.abstract: A point of entry to start a new span wrapped in an OTSpan.

Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.name: startSpan(operationName:references:startTime:tags:)
Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.abstract: A point of entry to a start a new span wrapped in an OTSpan.

Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.name: startSpan(operationName:childOf:startTime:tags:)
Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.abstract: A point of entry to start a new span wrapped in an OTSpan.

Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.name: startSpan(operationName:followsFrom:startTime:tags:)
Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.abstract: A point of entry to start a new span wrapped in an OTSpan.

Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.name: startRootSpan(operationName:startTime:tags:)
Protocols/Tracer.html#/s:6Jaeger6TracerP.abstract: A point of entry to start a new span wrapped in an OTSpan.

Protocols/SpanConvertible.html#/s:6Jaege.name: convert(span:)
Protocols/SpanConvertible.html#/s:6Jaege.abstract: To be used to convert a Span to a SpanConvertible compliant representation of the Span.

Protocols/SpanConvertible.html#/s:6Jaege.name: init(span:)
Protocols/SpanConvertible.html#/s:6Jaege.abstract: To be used to convert a Span to a SpanConvertible compliant representation of the Span.

Protocols/SpanSender.html#/s:6Jaeger10Sp.name: send(spans:completion:)
Protocols/SpanSender.html#/s:6Jaeger10Sp.abstract: Implement necessary networking logic to send spans to the Span collector. This function will need to be called by the Agent to report spans to the collector.

Protocols/Agent.html#/s:6Jaeger5AgentP10.name: spanSender
Protocols/Agent.html#/s:6Jaeger5AgentP10.abstract: An Agent needs a SpanSender reference that implements the necessary networking functionality to report spans.

Protocols/Agent.html#/s:6Jaeger5AgentP6r.name: record(span:)
Protocols/Agent.html#/s:6Jaeger5AgentP6r.abstract: Implement necessary logic to record the span data here. Recording includes any caching logic necessary to temporarily hold on to spans and also calling SpanSender’s send function to report the spans to the collector.

Protocols/CoreDataAgentErrorDelegate.htm.name: handleError(_:)
Protocols/CoreDataAgentErrorDelegate.htm.abstract: Called every time an error occurred in the CoreDataAgent.

Protocols/CoreDataAgentErrorDelegate.htm.name: CoreDataAgentErrorDelegate
Protocols/CoreDataAgentErrorDelegate.htm.abstract: A delegate receiving all errors from a CoreDataAgent.

Protocols/Agent.html.name: Agent
Protocols/Agent.html.abstract: An Agent is responsible for collecting spans from a tracer and using a SpanSender to report those spans to a collector. An agent needs to do two things:

Protocols/SpanSender.html.name: SpanSender
Protocols/SpanSender.html.abstract: The Span sender’s responsibility is to report spans to a Span collector. Use this protocol to write any networking code to send your spans to your collector. When initializing an Agent, a SpanSender needs to be supplied to it.

Protocols/SpanConvertible.html.name: SpanConvertible
Protocols/SpanConvertible.html.abstract: Use this protocol if you need to create a customized representation of a Span which your collector can injest.

Protocols/Tracer.html.name: Tracer
Protocols/Tracer.html.abstract: An interface representing chosen functionalities of the OpenTracing Tracer specifications. Any class implementing this interface should be able to create and relay spans.

Classes/OTSpan.html#/s:6Jaeger6OTSpanC7s.name: spanRef
Classes/OTSpan.html#/s:6Jaeger6OTSpanC7s.abstract: The reference for the current span. Useful to create a child span.

Classes/OTSpan.html#/s:6Jaeger6OTSpanC6f.name: finish(at:)
Classes/OTSpan.html#/s:6Jaeger6OTSpanC6f.abstract: An action to indicate that the task was completed.

Classes/BasicTracer.html#/s:6Jaeger11Bas.name: startSpan(operationName:referencing:startTime:tags:)
Classes/BasicTracer.html#/s:6Jaeger11Bas.abstract: A point of entry the crete a start a new span wrapped in an OTSpan.

Classes/JaegerJSONSender.html#/s:6Jaeger.name: init(endPoint:process:session:httpMethod:requestHeaders:)
Classes/JaegerJSONSender.html#/s:6Jaeger.abstract: Creates a new JaegerJSONSender by specifying the endpoint. This sender works exactly as a JSONSender, it only modifies the payload sent to the endpoint. The spans will be wrapped in a Batch according to the Jaeger.Thrift definition.

Classes/JaegerJSONSender.html#/s:6Jaeger.name: process
Classes/JaegerJSONSender.html#/s:6Jaeger.abstract: The process information for a Jeager Collector. It will be used to construct a Batch following the Jaeger.Thrift definition.

Classes/JSONSender/HttpMethod.html.name: HttpMethod
Classes/JSONSender/HttpMethod.html.abstract: A list of all acceptable HTTP methods used by the underlying URLRequest.

Classes/JSONSender.html#/s:6Jaeger10JSON.name: init(endPoint:session:httpMethod:requestHeaders:)
Classes/JSONSender.html#/s:6Jaeger10JSON.abstract: Creates a new JSONSender by specifying the endpoint.

Classes/JSONSender.html#/s:6Jaeger10JSON.name: send(spans:completion:)
Classes/JSONSender.html#/s:6Jaeger10JSON.abstract: Call this function to send spans to a specific endpoint using JSON encoding.

Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.name: tracer
Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.abstract: The tracer used to create all spans.

Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.name: sender
Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.abstract: The underlying sender used by the agent.

Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.name: init(config:endPointUrl:session:)
Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.abstract: Creates a new client by specifying the rules for the core data caching mechanism.

Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.name: init(config:process:endPointUrl:session:)
Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.abstract: Creates a new client by specifying the rules for the core data caching mechanism.

Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.name: init(config:sender:)
Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html#/s:6Ja.abstract: Creates a new client by specifying the rules for the core data caching mechanism.

Classes/CoreDataAgent.html#/s:6Jaeger13C.name: spanSender
Classes/CoreDataAgent.html#/s:6Jaeger13C.abstract: The point of entry to report spans to a collector.

Classes/CoreDataAgent.html#/s:6Jaeger13C.name: init(config:sender:)
Classes/CoreDataAgent.html#/s:6Jaeger13C.abstract: Creates a new agent from a specified configuration and span sender.

Classes/CoreDataAgent.html#/s:6Jaeger13C.name: record(span:)
Classes/CoreDataAgent.html#/s:6Jaeger13C.abstract: This function adds and saves the span locally.

Classes/CoreDataAgent.html.name: CoreDataAgent
Classes/CoreDataAgent.html.abstract: An agent using a Core Data Stack to save a binary representation of a span. The agent will save the spans periodically on disk in order to minimize the memory footprint and optimize disk writing operations. At regular intervals, spans will be fetched from the disk and send to the provided SpanSender.

Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html.name: JaegerCoreDataClient
Classes/JaegerCoreDataClient.html.abstract: A Jaeger client using core data as a caching mechanism and a configurable SpanSender.

Classes/JSONSender.html.name: JSONSender
Classes/JSONSender.html.abstract: A SpanSender designed to send spans at a specified URL using the JSON format.

Classes/JaegerJSONSender.html.name: JaegerJSONSender
Classes/JaegerJSONSender.html.abstract: A SpanSender designed to send spans at a specified URL using the JSON format. This sender works exactly as a JSONSender, it only modifies the payload sent to the endpoint. The spans will be wrapped in a Batch according to the Jaeger.Thrift definition.

Classes/BasicTracer.html.name: BasicTracer
Classes/BasicTracer.html.abstract: A tracer using a generic agent for the caching process.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
